project.name: Task Manager
project.description: Build a simple todo list application platform for personal task management serving 100+ active users. Key features: create tasks, mark complete, organize by categories, due dates, priority levels, search and filter. Scale to small team usage with real-time sync and ensure basic authentication and data privacy compliance.

relationships.description: A task belongs to one category
A task is assigned to one user
A task tag belongs to one task
An audit log is related to one user

indexRecommendations.reason: Frequent join operations on task_id and potential filtering on tag_id
Frequent filtering on user_id and log_date

normalizationIssues.suggestion: Consider storing category and priority names in separate tables and referencing them by ID
Create a separate table for tags and reference them by ID in task_tags

performanceWarnings: Frequent inserts and updates on the tasks table may lead to index fragmentation and slow down query performance
The logs and audit_logs tables may grow rapidly and impact query performance if not properly maintained
Inadequate indexing on the settings table may lead to slow query performance if it is frequently accessed

endpoints.description: Create a new task - POST /api/v1/tasks (Auth Required)
Get a task by ID - GET /api/v1/tasks/{id} (Auth Required)
Create a new category - POST /api/v1/categories (Auth Required)
Get a category by ID - GET /api/v1/categories/{id} (Auth Required)
Create a new priority - POST /api/v1/priorities (Auth Required)
Get a priority by ID - GET /api/v1/priorities/{id} (Auth Required)
Create a new setting - POST /api/v1/settings (Auth Required)
Get a setting by key - GET /api/v1/settings/{key} (Auth Required)

restIssues: /api/v1/settings/{key} should be /api/v1/settings/key to follow RESTful naming conventions

/api/v1/tasks/{id} and other similar endpoints should consider using plural nouns for consistency, e.g., /api/v1/tasks/{id} is correct but could be improved with a more descriptive identifier, such as /api/v1/tasks/item/{id}
securityRecommendations: /api/v1/auth/login and /api/v1/auth/register should implement rate limiting to prevent brute-force attacks
All endpoints under 'Tasks', 'Categories', 'Priorities', and 'Settings' should validate user input to prevent SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks
/api/v1/auth/login should use HTTPS to encrypt credentials
missingEndpoints: /api/v1/tasks/search to allow searching for tasks by keyword or filter
/api/v1/categories/{id}/tasks to retrieve tasks associated with a specific category
/api/v1/priorities/{id}/tasks to retrieve tasks with a specific priority
/api/v1/settings/export to export settings in a file format like JSON or CSV
/api/v1/settings/import to import settings from a file
aiInsights.rateLimiting: Apply rate limiting to /api/v1/auth/login, /api/v1/auth/register, /api/v1/tasks, /api/v1/categories, /api/v1/priorities, and /api/v1/settings to prevent abuse and denial-of-service (DoS) attacks
aiInsights.versioning: The current versioning pattern uses a URI path prefix (/api/v1/), which is a common approach. Consider using header-based versioning or query parameter-based versioning as alternatives.

decisions.title: Database Selection
decisions.description: Choose the best database solution for storing task data, user information, and other relevant details with strong ACID compliance and query performance

recommendations.name: PostgreSQL
recommendations.description: Advanced open-source relational database with excellent ACID compliance, rich feature set including JSON support, full-text search, and extensibility through custom functions and extensions
pros: Rich feature set with JSON and JSONB support
cons: Steeper learning curve compared to MySQL

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

recommendations.name: Amazon Aurora
recommendations.description: Cloud-native relational database with MySQL and PostgreSQL compatibility, offering 5x performance improvement with automated backups, auto-scaling storage, and multi-AZ deployments

pricing.details: Pay for compute, storage, and I/O separately. Costs scale with usage.

recommendations.name: MongoDB
recommendations.description: Document-oriented NoSQL database with flexible schema design, horizontal scaling capabilities, and rich query language for handling unstructured data

pricing.details: Community edition free, Enterprise features and Atlas managed service paid

decisions.reasoning: PostgreSQL is recommended for this task management application due to its strong ACID compliance ensuring data integrity for transactions, excellent support for complex queries needed for task searching and filtering, and JSON support for flexible task attributes. The open-source nature keeps costs low while providing enterprise-grade features. Strong community support and extensive documentation reduce development risk.

decisions.title: Cloud Infrastructure Selection
decisions.description: Select the cloud platform that will host the entire application infrastructure, providing compute, storage, networking, and managed services

recommendations.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
recommendations.description: Leading cloud platform with the most comprehensive service portfolio including EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, and 200+ services for building scalable applications
pros: Largest service portfolio in the industry
cons: Complex pricing can be difficult to predict

pricing.details: Pay-as-you-go for most services, reserved instances available for cost savings

recommendations.name: Google Cloud Platform
recommendations.description: Google's cloud platform with strong AI/ML capabilities, competitive pricing, and excellent Kubernetes support through GKE

pricing.details: Generally 20-30% cheaper than AWS for compute and storage with sustained use discounts

recommendations.name: Microsoft Azure
recommendations.description: Microsoft's cloud platform with excellent enterprise integration, strong hybrid cloud capabilities, and deep integration with Microsoft products

pricing.details: Competitive with AWS, good discounts for Microsoft customers with Enterprise Agreements

decisions.reasoning: AWS is recommended as the cloud provider due to its comprehensive service portfolio that can support all components of the task management application, mature ecosystem with proven reliability at scale, and strong marketplace for third-party integrations. While pricing is complex, the extensive documentation and large community make it easier to optimize costs. The global presence ensures low latency for customers worldwide.

decisions.title: CI/CD Pipeline Selection
decisions.description: Choose the continuous integration and deployment platform for automating build, test, and deployment workflows

recommendations.name: GitHub Actions
recommendations.description: Integrated CI/CD platform built into GitHub with workflow automation, rich marketplace of actions, and seamless integration with repositories
cons: Pricing for private repos can add up

pricing.details: Free for public repos, pay-per-use for private repos (2,000 free minutes/month)

recommendations.name: GitLab CI/CD
recommendations.description: Integrated DevOps platform with built-in CI/CD, security scanning, container registry, and comprehensive deployment capabilities

pricing.details: Free tier available, paid plans for advanced features (400 CI/CD minutes free)

recommendations.name: Jenkins
recommendations.description: Leading open-source automation server with extensive plugin ecosystem for building complex CI/CD pipelines

pricing.details: Free to use, infrastructure costs for hosting servers

decisions.reasoning: GitHub Actions is recommended for its seamless integration with GitHub repositories, ease of setup with YAML-based workflows, and rich marketplace of pre-built actions. The low complexity and excellent documentation enable rapid implementation. Free tier for private repos provides cost-effective starting point, and the platform scales well as the project grows.

decisions.title: API Gateway Selection
decisions.description: Choose the API gateway solution for managing API requests, security, and analytics

recommendations.name: AWS API Gateway
recommendations.description: Fully managed API gateway service for creating, publishing, maintaining, monitoring, and securing APIs at scale
pros: Security features like authentication and rate limiting

pricing.details: Pay for API calls, data transfer, and cache storage

recommendations.name: NGINX
recommendations.description: Popular open-source web server and reverse proxy that can be used as an API gateway
cons: Limited support for advanced API gateway features

pricing.details: Free to use, infrastructure costs for hosting servers

decisions.reasoning: AWS API Gateway is recommended for its fully managed service, ease of integration with AWS services, and robust security features. The usage-based pricing model provides cost-effectiveness for high-volume API traffic.

decisions.title: Authentication Solution Selection

recommendations.name: AWS Cognito
recommendations.description: Fully managed user identity and access service for mobile and web applications
pros: Supports user registration, login, and password recovery

pricing.details: Pay for active users, data storage, and SMS messages

recommendations.name: Auth0
recommendations.description: Universal authentication platform for web, mobile, and IoT applications
pros: Extensive set of features for user management

pricing.details: Pay for active users, with discounts for large volumes

decisions.reasoning: AWS Cognito is recommended for its fully managed service, ease of integration with AWS services, and robust security features. The usage-based pricing model provides cost-effectiveness for high-volume user traffic.

pricing.details: Pay for hosts, with discounts for large volumes

decisions.reasoning: New Relic is recommended for its comprehensive monitoring and analytics capabilities, real-time monitoring and alerts, and deep performance analysis. The usage-based pricing model provides cost-effectiveness for high-volume application traffic.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Microservices Architecture
smartRecommendations.description: Design the application as a collection of small, independent services for tasks, categories, and authentication. This will improve scalability, allow for easier maintenance, and enable the development team to work on different components simultaneously.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Redis for Real-Time Sync
smartRecommendations.description: Utilize Redis as an in-memory data store to enable real-time synchronization of tasks across users. This will ensure that all users have the most up-to-date task list and will improve the overall user experience.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement JWT-Based Authentication
smartRecommendations.description: Use JSON Web Tokens (JWT) to handle user authentication. This will provide a secure and stateless way to authenticate users and ensure that only authorized users can access and modify tasks.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Indexing for Efficient Search and Filter
smartRecommendations.description: Create indexes on relevant columns in the tasks table to improve the efficiency of search and filter operations. This will reduce the load on the database and improve the overall performance of the application.

smartRecommendations.title: Design a Scalable Database Schema
smartRecommendations.description: Design the database schema to scale horizontally by using techniques such as sharding or replication. This will ensure that the database can handle the increased load as the number of users grows.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Data Encryption
smartRecommendations.description: Encrypt sensitive data such as user passwords and task descriptions to ensure that even if the data is compromised, it will be unreadable. This will improve the overall security of the application and protect user data.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Create indexes on frequently queried columns
optimizationSuggestions.description: Create indexes on the tasks table for columns like category_id, due_date, and priority_id to improve query performance when filtering and searching tasks.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement caching for frequently accessed data
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use Redis to cache frequently accessed data like user settings, categories, and priorities to reduce database queries and improve application performance.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Optimize database queries for real-time sync
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use connection pooling and optimize database queries to improve real-time sync performance, ensuring that tasks are updated and reflected in the application quickly.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Use load balancing for scalability
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use load balancing to distribute traffic across multiple servers, ensuring that the application can handle increased traffic and scale to meet the needs of small teams.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement rate limiting for authentication
optimizationSuggestions.description: Implement rate limiting for authentication attempts to prevent brute-force attacks and ensure the security of user accounts.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Schedule regular log rotation and cleanup
optimizationSuggestions.description: Schedule regular log rotation and cleanup to ensure that logs do not grow too large and impact application performance, and to maintain data privacy compliance.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement performance monitoring and alerting
optimizationSuggestions.description: Implement performance monitoring and alerting to track application performance, identify bottlenecks, and receive alerts when issues arise, ensuring prompt resolution and minimal downtime.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Strong Password Policies and Multi-Factor Authentication
securityRecommendations.description: Enforce password policies that require a minimum length of 12 characters, including uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters. Implement MFA using time-based one-time passwords (TOTP) or universal 2nd factor (U2F) to add an extra layer of security for user authentication.

securityRecommendations.title: Use Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for Authorization
securityRecommendations.description: Implement RBAC to restrict access to tasks and features based on user roles. For example, administrators can manage user accounts and settings, while regular users can only manage their own tasks and categories.

securityRecommendations.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data at Rest and in Transit
securityRecommendations.description: Use a secure encryption algorithm like AES-256 to encrypt sensitive data, such as user passwords and task descriptions, both at rest (in the database) and in transit (over HTTPS). Ensure that all data is encrypted before storing it in the database.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Secure Server Configuration and Monitoring
securityRecommendations.description: Configure servers to use secure protocols (e.g., HTTPS, SSH) and disable unnecessary services. Monitor server logs and performance metrics to detect potential security issues and optimize server performance.

securityRecommendations.title: Use Secure Communication Protocols for Real-Time Sync
securityRecommendations.description: Use secure communication protocols like WebSockets over TLS (WSS) or WebRTC to enable real-time sync between clients and servers. Ensure that all communication is encrypted and authenticated to prevent eavesdropping and tampering.

securityRecommendations.title: Regularly Update Dependencies and Patch Vulnerabilities
securityRecommendations.description: Regularly update dependencies and patch known vulnerabilities in the application and its dependencies to prevent exploitation by attackers. Use tools like npm audit or OWASP Dependency Check to identify and fix vulnerabilities.
